title: HTML Encoding (Character Sets)
gp1: To display an HTML page correctly, a web browser must know which character set to use.
gp2: The character set is specified in the <meta> tag:
gp3: The HTML5 specification encourages web developers to use the UTF-8 character set.
gp4: UTF-8 covers almost all of the characters and symbols in the world!
wp1: ANSI (Windows-1252) was the original Windows character set:
wp2: ISO-8859-1 was the default character set for HTML 4. This character set supported 256 different character codes. HTML 4 also supported UTF-8.
wp3: ASCII was the first character encoding standard for the web. It defined 128 different characters that could be used on the internet:
